alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Little River, Hempstead, Miller, Sevier, northern Lafayette, Howard, southern McCurtain, northeastern Cass, Bowie and Red River Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 1214 AM CDT, NWS Meteorologists were tracking a large heatburst to the north and east of severe thunderstorms over Northeast Texas, with southwest winds gusting to near 40 mph across Southern McCurtain County Oklahoma as well as Texarkana. These gusty winds are spreading northeast into Southwest Arkansas with areas of light rain, with temperatures rising some 10 to 15 degrees shortly after the onset of the gusty southwest winds. It is possible these winds could strengthen across the area over the next hour. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Hope, De Queen, Wake Village, Ashdown, Nashville, New Boston, Clarksville, Stamps, Lewisville, Mineral Springs, Dierks, Horatio, Foreman, Boxelder, Idabel, Broken Bow, Nash, Hooks and De Kalb. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...southeastern Oklahoma...and northeastern Texas.
